name: Hilton Manhattan East

reviews.text: I needed a room in NYC for one night as I had to fly out of JFK the day after. I thought NY hotels were unaffordable but in this Hilton I paid 189 US which is very reasaonable. yes the room was rather small, but it had all I needed.
reviews.title: Small rooms but great location and OK price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can recommend it. Staff in NYC is generally rude but here people were friendly. Breakfast is not really recommendable. I did not particularly like it, and it was pretty expensive. rest was very good
reviews.title: Pleasant hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My sister got reservations for us for one night side-by-side, on the 13th floor overlooking 43rd St. mid- September. We were all very pleased with the accomodations. The room was small, but comfortable and clean. The bed was very comfortable.The desk clerk was helpful and friendly and there was valet service which we appreciated since we drove into New York. We were very near the U.N. and a charming little park called Tudor Village within walking distance. If you open the window and lean out a bit you can see the Chrysler building. We were in comfortable walking distance to Grand Central Station, which is convenient if you plan to ride the subway. With so much to do and see in NY you will not want to spend much time in your room, so this hotel is more than adequate.I should mention that the rate was much lower due to the fact that we stayed on a Sunday night. I highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Delightful

reviews.text: This was our first visit to this Hilton and we were very pleased with the stay. The location was great. It is right around the corner from the UN. The service was very good. The full American breakfast was very tasty. We had salads and drinks in the bar in the late afternoon and we were very pleased with both the quality and service. We will definitely stay here again. I agree with other reviewers that the AC noise at night was bothersome.
reviews.title: Prison cells must be larger

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is absolutely nothing special, memorable or distinctive about this loosely labeled "boutique hotel" The staff is disinterested, lacks follow up skills and the ability to pretend they care. Equipment (Irons, haird dryers) pretty well shot but the rooms, my God the rooms are they small. Club Quarters is known as the cell hotel this is worse. Maybe 8 x 10 with a queen bed. Claustrophobia? this is not your hotel and at about $500. per night, no bargain.
reviews.title: Mediocre mid town manhattan accomodations

reviews.text: Stayed here for a business trip. Really central location and a bit cheaper than other hotels in the area. The rooms are tight, even for a NYC hotel and the AC noise made it hard to get a good night sleep. Still, the service was great and overall a good spot to stay for a quick trip.
reviews.title: Good location for price
Teeny tiny room(s)!!
reviews.text: This hotel is a bit of a mix. It's central-ish, for a mid-priced hotel (on 2nd/44th, I think) - quite nice views of red-brick high-rises and slight views of the water beyond. It's possible some rooms are bigger, so check before you book, as my room was TINY! And my colleague could hardly get his door open, so he moved the chair and table to outside his room into the (also v small) corridor so that he could get in with his case! As it was, when I opened my door, it banged against the table with the T.V. on it, and the same problem, I couldn't open my door fully as the table was in the way! There was also a little writing table, and a chair, which left virtually no room for anything else... I managed to balance my suitcase on top of the chair, as there was literally nowhere else left to put it. The bathroom was immediately by the bed. It was really the teeniest hotel room I've stayed in in living memory and was much smaller than my bedroom at home, ditto the ensuite!! Which was sort of funny in a way, but I don't think it's suitable for more than one night or for two people, or anyone of a larger build. Definitely ask room sizes if you book here and see if they have anything normal!!! Also, as another reviewer has mentioned, the light switches were very bizarre and I certainly couldn't work out how they worked the entire time I was there. Also same for the a/c, which remained on "freezing" setting despite all attempts to warm it up. Luckily, the hotel provided an extra blanket in the wardrobe, which I was grateful for as it was so cold in my room. On the plus side, it was fairly quiet. Everything seemed very pristine and clean, new bathroom, and furniture looked new. The reception staff were also nice. But I cannot give it a high rating as I felt the room was ridiculously small and it was freezing (whilst pleasantly warm outside, I should add!).

I have stayed at this hotel on several occasions for business and pleasure. It is in a good location right on 42nd and second but a bit off beaten track so that it is not too busy. Right near UN and Grand Central. Service is good and the room are well maintained. Ever since Hilton took over a few years ago things have improved significantly.
reviews.title: Goof midtown hotel

reviews.text: Heading to New York in July was not going to be a cheap affair so I had to reign in my expectations. The Hilton did a fairly good deal and so Manhattan East was within my budget. I was very well aware that it would be on the lower end of the Hilton scale so I wasn't expecting out of the ordinary. The stay was pleasant, the staff fairly nice (for NYC standards), and rooms were clean (although in need of a more in-depth refurb). From what I understand the hotel only joined the Hilton portfolio not too long ago and it shows. It seems that all they did with the rooms was stick in Hilton-standard beds and TVs. There are for example power sockets next to the bed about a meter up from the floor but without a table to put anything on. So when you plug in your mobile is sort of dangles off the wall.
reviews.title: Location is great. Hotel is so-so.

reviews.text: The breakfast was a bit of a letdown and nothing to write home about. What really annoyed me was that it seemed as if they had the policy of only filling the glasses half full with orange juice. A self service juice station with small glasses would have been fine (and pretty standard). However, using full size glasses and having the waiter only fill it up to half does not make sense to me, cost cutting or not.
reviews.title: Cramped
Great location!
reviews.text: Stayed four nights, lovely hotel with an old world feel. The rooms were small but cozy with well appointed bathrooms. Easy walking distance to all the sights! It was our first trip to New York and we were made to feel very welcome! Great staff! Thank you for a lovely stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for two nights at the Hilton Manhattan East over Labor Day. Nice modern lobby, front desk efficient and friendly, elevators lightning quick. Room was fairly small, even by Manhattan standards, but felt cozy rather than squished. Bathroom was fairly sizable, however, and nicely accessorized. Best of all, one of the quietest hotel rooms I have ever stayed in (maybe because it was older construction with better sound insulation). Very relaxing place to return after a long day exploring Manhattan.
reviews.title: Nice Labor Day weekend stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I did feel that several standard services were not provided/unavailable. First valet parking was not offered (just for the weekend, per the receptionist). Also the concierge was MIA for extended periods (i.e. 5-8 PM on Sunday). And the fitness center seemed like it wasn't cleaned over Sunday PM, or longer. Perhaps some staff shortage over the holiday? Nonetheless would not hesitate to return.
reviews.title: nice hotel good location

reviews.text: My Fiance and I recently stayed for 2 nights, 3 days. The location is convenient to sights and good restaurants.
reviews.title: Had two good stays here

reviews.text: The entire staff was friendly and very helpful, the room was very clean.
reviews.title: Good Hotel in Great Location

reviews.text: This is my first time in the hotel. I've spent total of four nights there.
reviews.title: Good hotel
Good location, nice staff
reviews.text: Very well situated hotel. It's right on the intersection of EAST42nd street and 2nd avenue. To the right of the hotel, one street and you will come up to the UN building. To the left, 15 minutes fast pace walk and you are at Times Square. Grand Central station is 5 minutes walk. There are 24 hrs CVS Pharmacy for all your last minute supplies.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel get a WiFi. Now, if u want it in your room it costs 15 dollars for 24 hrs. You can get a complimentary free WiFi in the lobby of the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
Good location
reviews.text: Can't say much about the breakfast, i didn't take the option, however, when i asked for the prices it was about 27$ per continental breakfast. This is my first time in NYC, i am not aware of other hotel prices, but i do believe it's a little on the high side to spend that much for the breakfast.
Gym is free and open 24 hrs. Your standard set of dumbells, few cardio machines, towels, watermachine and the dry sauna in the changeroom.
reviews.title: Unique Hotel

description: Formerly the Tudor Hotel, this Midtown historic boutique hotel was transformed and reopened in 2010 as the Hilton Midtown East. 300 Guest Rooms and Suites located on East 42nd St. Walking distance to Grand Central, Midtown and the United Nations.
